result.execSummary:
The defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Misdemeanor)], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES.
Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

**Restitution is set at 0.**

No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.

Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
PARENTING CLASSES.

Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

timeConds.notes:
**12-11-15/ Judge Jeffrey A Wagner**
Defendant is non-compliant with the conditions of Probation.
The Court ordered the defendant taken into custody to spend 60 days, Straight Time, with NO Good Time credit, as condition time, in the HOC.             **************

Stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cassandra Felicia Davis

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Reflects 12-11-15 Court order imposing 60 days of condition time

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Court admonished defendant for non-compliance and ordered defendant to serve 60 days of the condition time; straight time; forthwith.  Commitment For Condition Time For Non-Compliance With Probation Conditions - Domestic Violence Court signed and filed.
Per Order signed on 9/14/2015, Judge David Borowski for Judge Jeffrey A. Wagner.
9/15/15 ck #335517 was returned by USPS unable to forward.

Br 12 for 38:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.
IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the JOC shall be amended to reflect the defendant is convicted of battery while armed under sections 940.19(1) and 939.63(1)(a)
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify weapons enhancer on count one.
Bail Refund Check Packet

As to the amended charge:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  
  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.   Statements by the state, defense and defendant.   Defendant sentenced to serve 10 months  in the House of Correction with credit for 6 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 12-11-2015 at 1:15pm.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate. PARENTING CLASSES.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent or court has approved contact.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample and pay costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Restitution is set at 0.
Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for Nick Heitman for the State of Wisconsin.
Upon motion of the state,  charge is amended to BATTERY WHILE ARMED, a class A misdemeanor, 940.19(1) and 939.63(1)(c).  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

Violation Report from Justice Point, received and filed.
-- Missed Telephone Contact: 7-9-2015.   mld

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-21-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.   mld
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
with all prior conditions.   mld

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
FILE NOT IN COURT.  Bench Warrant Withdrawn by the Court.  Discovery received by defense counsel.  Offer needed by defense counsel.  Court admonished defendant.  Court reinstated the forfeited cash bail.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis not in court.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was originally tabbed to branch 23, then retabbed to branch 4, due to the assignment of ADA Nicholas Heitman.  The Court was advised that defense counsel would be unavailable today's date.   Case called at 11:00 am.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to issue.   mld
Due to ADA assignment case is reassigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Justice Point Report.

15RM021412  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
0422/2015

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Lamar B. or Nikia R.

Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Cassandra Felicia Davis in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
